file_content.text: Affirmative!
Sir? How can I be of service?
You needn't worry, sir, my armored chassis is impenetrable to your touch, no matter how repetitive!
Sir! It is a tremendous pleasure to be here aboard your ship. And what a ship it is!
A BT-7, if I'm not mistaken. One of the Pollad designs--a very fine vessel, appropriate for the Republic's best.
We will ride this durasteel eagle into the heart of the Empire and bring our fight for freedom to the door of the Emperor himself!
You'll make a great addition to Havoc.
Welcome to the team.
I'm proud to know that you feel that way!
We'll get to that as soon as our other missions are complete.
Um... okay.
Fantastic, sir!
I really don't need a patriotic speech every five seconds.
Calm down, please.
Of course not, sir--I'm sure your patriotism is as unflinching as my own!
I have loaded all pertinent data--let us proceed with our noble duty!
Sir, I cannot describe how proud I am of Havoc Squad's accomplishments.
By all measurable statistics, we've had a real and significant effect on the Republic's success in the war against the Empire.
You are an unparalleled leader--a warrior without equal. As long as I continue to function, I will proudly serve at your side.
You're the finest combat droid I've ever known. I'm honored to fight with you.
I'll be glad to have you.
Thank you very much, sir!
I'll always be glad to take down Imps with you.
Years of carnage to come.
As will I, sir!
I am planning on retiring someday, Forex.
I won't be fighting forever.
And when you do, I'm certain that I will receive special dispensation to carry on as your loyal bodyguard and comrade-in-arms!
Someday soon, the Republic will march to victory atop the burnt husk of the Empire, with Havoc Squad leading the charge!
It was a trap, sir! Colonel Rebus was even more devious than I had expected!
You mean it was all a setup?
What happened?
You're here, so I'm guessing the trap didn't work.
Can't have been too bad.
Affirmative--in spite of the odds arrayed against me, I still managed to prevail!
Sounds like you underestimated your target.
You should've been careful.
I was not alone in the deception--the SIS also believed this was a genuine opportunity to strike.
All of the hints and clues that led me to Rebus were fabricated. It was all a scheme to capture my power core!
As soon as I defeated the last of the Imperial security teams and confronted Rebus, he activated a special-built device that overloaded my primary energy controls. I was frozen!
How did you manage to turn the tables on him?
How did you escape?
How could Rebus neutralize your power core when he'd never even seen it?
That doesn't seem possible.
I can't be sure, sir. Perhaps some documentation was made during my time as an unwilling accomplice to the Havoc traitors.
I'm surprised you got out in one piece.
What a mess.
It was a very tense situation, no doubt about it.
As Rebus and his final few guards approached, I discovered that I still had control over a handful of secondary subsystems.
By manipulating those systems, I was able to trigger a full emergency shutdown and a rear servo lock, violently propelling me forward just as Rebus came to face me.
You actually escaped by collapsing on the guy?
You fell on him.
I guess that's one way to take someone down.
Creative, I'll give you that.
It was a desperate ploy--but it was successful!
You're telling me that shutting yourself off saved the day?
This is insane.
Precisely, sir!
As I'd hoped, shutting down my power core caused Rebus's device to shut down as well. All systems were restored within ninety-six seconds.
Rebus's surviving guards were still attempting to lift me off of him at the time, so I dealt with them and carried the colonel back to base. Mission accomplished!
That's definitely one for the records, Forex.
I'd say so.
Was Rebus injured when you fell on him?
Was he hurt?
Yes, but luckily, Republic medical technology is the best in the galaxy--I was assured that he has a nonzero chance of speaking and walking again!
These missions have to stop, Forex. They're too dangerous.
This has gone too far.
Nothing is too dangerous for Havoc Squad, sir!
With Rebus in custody, the entire galaxy is a safer place.
It will be some time before I can locate an even more impressive target. As soon as I do, you'll be the first to know!
Our opportunity has arrived, sir! We've received intelligence reports that Colonel Rebus is about to test his latest project!
A secret proving ground has been established on Hoth. Security will be extensive, but nothing compared to Rebus's usual protection.
Sounds like you've got your opening.
Perfect.
How long do we have to move on this?
When does testing begin?
We have no intelligence on the length of the testing process. I believe it would be best to act as quickly as possible.
I hate that frozen rock.
Not Hoth again.
It's fitting that vermin would take shelter in such an inhospitable location.
Neutralizing Colonel Rebus will devastate the Empire's weapons programs. Even I cannot calculate the number of lives that this mission could save.
By robbing our enemies of their most despicable weapons, we will rob them of victory--ensuring freedom for generations to come!
I will set out at your command, sir! By robbing our enemies of their most despicable weapons, we will rob them of victory!
Sir! I've found information on weapon projects that Colonel Rebus was involved in! Would you like to hear about them?
What has Colonel Rebus been up to?
Let's hear it.
Go ahead, Forex. I've got a few minutes.
I guess so.
Most recently, Colonel Rebus was involved in the Gauntlet superweapon that we so skillfully destroyed.
He's had a hand in many other projects over the past eighteen years. The Blight Matrix, the Galactophage, Subjugation Droids--even the Plasm Resource!
Supposedly, he even designed a device that could permanently block hyperlanes, though the project was scrapped due to power limitations.
Do you know anything about Rebus's current project?
What is he doing now?
We have no details on his current project, other than a few intelligence reports confirming that it's near completion.
Rebus sounds like an experienced mass murderer.
That's quite a career.
It's unlikely that anyone in the galaxy has more experience in this field than Rebus.
There's no way one guy could design that many weapons.
I don't buy it.
Our reports indicate varying levels of participation in each project, though he was a key factor in all of them.
Once his new project enters the testing phase, we will stand a much better chance of locating Rebus himself.
I will report to you as soon as I know more.
Unless you know where he is, I don't want to hear about it.
No.
Oh. Very well, sir.
Sir? If I may ask, I was wondering about your opinion on Imperial superweapons--devices that can devastate entire fleets or worlds in a single strike. I find them intriguing.
No one should have weapons that powerful.
Superweapons are horrific.
That is a popular viewpoint, but I cannot understand it. Surely such devices could see worthwhile use in the defense of freedom!
I don't like the sentiment, but I am interested in the science behind them.
The technology is interesting.
I feel the same way, sir! Incredible devices, turned to despicable purpose by minds incapable of morality.
A superweapon or two would end this war a lot faster.
I wish we had some.
I agree. These devices may be the product of twisted and sadistic minds, but they're still exceptional pieces of technology.
Given these weapons' capabilities, I've been researching Imperial weapon designers to find a worthy target for Havoc Squad.
One name stands out above all others: Colonel Rebus, the head of one of the Empire's top weapons research programs.
What have you learned about him, Forex?
Brief me.
A brainy colonel sitting in a lab someplace? Easy pickings.
Doesn't sound too tough.
You'll just keep picking harder targets until you're destroyed, won't you?
You really are suicidal.
Based on the intelligence I've collected, this operation will fall well within our squad's acceptable survival probability at 4,790 to one.
I have located no personal information on Colonel Rebus--not even a physical description.
Over the past two weeks, however, mentions of his name on Imperial comm channels have increased in frequency by 15.2 percent. This suggests a project nearing completion.
No time to lose, then. Where is he?
We'd better act fast.
You could take out Rebus and his new invention at the same time.
Sounds like an opportunity!
That is my hope, sir! A truly profound victory for the Republic!
Maybe the Imps are chatting about how useless the guy is.
Talk could mean anything.
That would be a stark contrast with all of our available intelligence, sir.
The location of Colonel Rebus's research lab is one of the most closely guarded secrets in the Empire. No information is available as yet.
As soon as I learn more, I'll inform you right away!
I have excellent news, sir!
Given the rigorous nature of Havoc Squad's missions, my power core has seen extensive use--and its capabilities have increased as a result.
I now have access to far greater energy reserves, significantly improving the quality of my service to the Republic!
You must be very proud, Forex.
That's great!
I am, sir!
Have you reached the power core's maximum output?
Is that the max?
Not yet, sadly. But someday!
You need more discipline, not more power.
You'll just be more reckless.
I do not understand your meaning, sir. My designers ensured that I am the most disciplined soldier conceivable by modern science.
Please, sir--if I may make a request, let's engage in combat as soon as possible. I'm eager to put my new capabilities to the test!
Target neutralized, sir! Lord Kavos will threaten the innocent people of the galaxy no longer!
As expected, his overconfidence made his defeat all but certain. I simply took my place among the scum hoping to gain his favor, then struck at the first opportunity.
I'll bet that got you a lot closer than you would have otherwise.
Good thinking.
Precisely, sir!
Was it a big crowd?
How many were there?
Counting myself, there were fifteen applicants for that Sith fool's "opportunity".
I'm surprised you didn't charge straight in.
You didn't just rush him?
Of course not! This was a situation calling for shrewd tactics.
Lord Kavos decided that a fight to the death would determine his champion--every man for himself. Once the fighting began, I closed in.
I started by grabbing a Nikto thug who was making liberal use of a flamethrower. With pinpoint accuracy, I hurled him toward Kavos, whose robes were instantly ignited!
I imagine that kept Kavos's attention pretty well.
A pretty good diversion.
It did, sir!
I wish I could've seen the look on Kavos's face.
Hilarious!
I would estimate that he was surprised, sir.
I'm surprised Kavos didn't spot the giant, burning Nikto heading his way.
That actually worked?
I threw him with considerable speed, sir. Additionally, the sheer volume of flames being produced made evasion or deflection impossible.
Although Kavos was thoroughly distracted, I remained cautious, and did not engage him directly. Instead, I targeted a nearby Mandalorian using a jetpack.
As soon as his velocity and flight vector were pointed correctly, I opened fire with my cannons, sending him barrelling into Kavos and the Nikto. The explosion did the rest.
It sounds like you carried out your mission with exceptional skill.
Very impressive.
Thank you very much, sir!
Was anybody left standing when you were done?
Any survivors?
Negative. All surviving applicants were listed as persons of interest to the SIS, so I elected to remain and subdue them all.
You probably shouldn't let this one go to your head, Forex.
Sounds like you got lucky.
I'm not sure I understand, sir.
This was a critical victory--our comrades are sure to take heart when they hear that a monster like Kavos has been laid low.
I'll begin searching for a new target at once!
Success, sir! Lord Kavos has foolishly given away his position!
To all who excel in the arts of death: be it known that Lord Kavos, master of combat, seeks a lieutenant to serve him.
I seek a worthy right hand to carry out my commands across the galaxy--and profit immensely.
Those who think themselves suited should present themselves at the coordinates included in this message. Come prepared.
Kavos had to know this would be intercepted. He isn't afraid of anything, is he?
This guy's fearless.
Don't worry, sir. He'll learn to fear the justice of the Republic soon enough!
Who did Kavos send this message to?
Where did you get this?
The message was broadcast freely in many underworld channels, and delivered personally to a number of high-profile bounty hunters.
Kavos is just trying to lure in his enemies.
Sounds like a trap to me.
That might be true, sir. But no amount of planning could prepare him to face Havoc Squad!
The coordinates are on Tatooine, sir. I recommend we move quickly, before Kavos can find a suitable lieutenant and move on.
For the Republic!
I'll set out as soon as you give the order!
Sir! I've discovered the perfect target for our next operation: Lord Kavos.
Kavos is a marauding Sith lord responsible for countless deaths: exactly the type of dangerous scum we're uniquely qualified to eliminate.
Give me the full brief, Forex.
Tell me about him.
With pleasure, sir!
He sounds like an excellent choice.
Perfect.
Going up against a Sith Lord isn't something to look forward to.
You're much too excited.
I apologize if I seem overeager, sir. But this bloodthirsty degenerate isn't just an enemy of the Republic--he's an opportunity!
Lord Kavos singlehandedly destroyed a Republic outpost on Brentaal Four, massacring its personnel. He fought and killed two Jedi Knights simultaneously!
According to intelligence reports, this butcher is becoming a hero to the Empire's ravening masses. Neutralizing him will help our cause greatly.
Let's make this a priority. Tell me as soon as we have a location.
Agreed.
What did you say about him killing two Jedi Knights?
Wait, go back a bit.
Ayesho and Nil, two renowned Jedi with years of combat experience. Lord Kavos cut them down without suffering a single injury.
I can't tell you how much I'm looking forward to facing this threat head-on, sir! I'm going to begin my search right away!
I'm still not sure this is a good idea, Forex.
I'll think about it.
Then I've clearly failed to properly express the value of this mission, and I apologize!
This mission will increase Republic morale, decrease Imperial morale, and save countless lives by neutralizing a murderous psychopath.
As soon as I know more, I'll inform you right away, sir!
Sir? I'm wondering if you'd be kind enough to share what you know about Force users?
I've only been programmed with a basic knowledge of Jedi and Sith capabilities. What do you think about them?
Jedi and Sith are capable of some pretty amazing things.
The Force is very powerful.
That's what my records indicate.
The Force, Jedi, Sith... they aren't my problem.
I don't think about them.
A common sentiment, according to my records. Many see their teachings as nonsensical, and I can't help but agree.
The Jedi are crazy, and the only people crazier are the Sith.
They're all crackpots.
I had noticed that many of their beliefs are illogical with regard to the defense of a state.
I only ask because it is a commonly-held belief that so-called "ordinary" soldiers are no match for Force users in combat.
Clearly that belief is false, but it persists. I suggest that I target a notable Sith Lord and neutralize him--publicly.
Sith are deadly, Forex--let's not take them lightly.
Be cautious.
Of course, sir!
I've always wanted to put those slimeballs in their place.
Sounds like fun.
I'm glad you share my enthusiasm!
I'll let you know as soon as I find a suitable target!
Hunting down a Sith lord? This is going too far, Forex.
It's too dangerous.
I don't believe anything is too far for Havoc Squad, sir.
I've been reviewing morale surveys and after-action combat effectiveness reports, and I have good news!
For the period following the neutralization of the Ambassador, statistics are up throughout the Republic's armed forces!
It's good to hear the plan is working.
That's great news!
You did something amazing, of course people are reacting.
No surprise there.
The plan has worked flawlessly.
Is there any proof that your mission is the cause?
It's probably a coincidence.
Proof? One of the Empire's most public figures was felled in a single stroke! What else could it be?
I am concerned that we might see diminishing returns from future missions unless our targets become even more impressive, though.
Havoc Squad's new quarry will have to be someone truly savage--a merciless threat to all that's good and decent in the galaxy.
This was all your idea, Forex. Target selection is up to you.
It's your decision.
Thank you very much, sir. I won't let you down!
No matter how bad they are, there's no way they're a match for you.
Go for it!
My thoughts exactly!
We can't be sidetracked hunting individual targets, Forex. We have other duties.
Don't take this too far.
Of course, sir! I will not allow my investigations to interfere with our other operations.
We'll have this war won in no time, sir!
Sir! I am pleased to report that the mission was a complete success!
Though the Ambassador had fifteen armed guards in his casino suite, I managed to storm through them all, grab the lying fool, and leap out through the window!
Sounds like you really took them by surprise.
Nice!
Very much so, sir! The enemy never had a chance.
Is the Ambassador still in one piece after that?
Did he survive?
Of course, sir!
That's a lot of noise for a place that's supposed to be neutral.
Sounds reckless.
No need for concern, sir! I checked with the SIS beforehand--there were no external security cams at that altitude.
Having timed my assault perfectly, the Ambassador and I landed on a passing Ugnaught salvage scow after a mere hundred and thirty meter fall.
Once I had made my apologies to the proprietors of the scow, I turned my prisoner over to the SIS, and the toll of liberty rang out across the galaxy!
Excellent work, Forex.
Well done.
Wasn't the Ambassador at least injured by that fall?
I'm surprised he lived.
He suffered only minor injuries. Fifteen fractures, some lacerations and abrasions, and a ruptured spleen. Nothing bacta and a skilled surgical droid can't fix!
You're tough, Forex, but you're going to get pummeled if you keep pulling stunts like that.
Be more subtle next time.
I assure you, sir, I was in no immediate danger. All risks were thoroughly calculated several microseconds beforehand.
Now that the Ambassador's influence won't be spewing across the galaxy, I suspect we'll see a marked improvement in Republic morale.
The only problem now will be selecting an even more impressive target!
Sir! We've had a breakthrough! The Ambassador has been spotted!
He's staying in a suite at the Star Cluster Casino on Nar Shaddaa. If I move quickly, I can take him before he's relocated!
Sounds like a plan, Forex.
Perfect.
Won't we cause problems if you assault Imperial personnel on Nar Shaddaa?
Isn't Nar Shaddaa neutral?
Only if I'm caught in the act, sir--and Havoc never fails!
I don't know if there's time for this.
We'll see.
The incredibly high risk factors demand a swift operation, sir. I'll be finished in no time!
For the Republic!
I'll set out at your command, sir!
Sir! I've found our first potential target for the morale improvement initiative: an Imperial propagandist known as the Ambassador.
I've collected a sample of his lies for your review:
Friends--the Ambassador would have you know that you needn't live in fear. You needn't bow to men who are your inferiors.
In the Empire, you can live a life of purpose and accomplishment, where only those most fit to rule guide our society. A life of greatness!
Give me our intel on this guy.
What do we know about him?
The SIS has found no concrete data. He effectively has no personal history before becoming "the Ambassador"--clearly an Imperial cover-up.
Surely no one's falling for tripe like this.
Does anyone believe that junk?
If it were not effective, even the fools in the Empire wouldn't bother with it.
Just a few seconds of that guy talking is enough for me.
I already want him dead.
These spurious recordings are broadcast all over the galaxy, filling people with doubts about our noble cause.
The Ambassador is the public face of our enemy. Removing him will boost Republic troops' morale and combat effectiveness.
As soon as you locate the Ambassador, let me know.
Let's make it happen.
You'll be the first person I notify, sir!
Maybe you can take him out in the middle of a broadcast.
Sounds like fun.
We can only hope we'll be so fortunate, sir!
This guy isn't even a soldier. He's a broadcaster.
He's not a worthy target.
I respectfully disagree, sir. He is a soldier, waging war on the hearts and minds of our people.
The SIS is actively searching for the Ambassador, but he's difficult to track down.
As soon as I have more information, you'll be the first to know, sir!
Sir? If you have a moment, I've developed an initiative to improve morale amongst our fellow soldiers.
As we both know, Havoc Squad is the finest military team ever assembled. Our triumphs prove to the public that victory is near!
Unfortunately, as a team, even we can only accomplish so many victories in a given amount of time. Therefore, I would like to undertake additional assignments on my own time.
What kind of additional assignments?
What do you have in mind?
That isn't a simple request, Forex.
I'd have to think about it.
I'm fully aware, sir! I assure you, I wouldn't ask if I didn't think the work would greatly benefit the Republic.
You expect me to authorize you for solo ops?
Are you joking?
Yes, sir! And not just normal operations, either.
I'd like to coordinate with Command and the SIS to find extra targets--Imperial personnel no one else could challenge--and neutralize them.
Some tough wins would really get our troops fired up.
That's a great idea.
Are you sure these are targets you could handle on your own?
Sounds risky.
Absolutely, sir! My success is a mathematical and moral certainty!
Havoc has enough work to do as it is, Forex.
We don't have time.
But sir, I could make a real difference!
My calculations suggest the Republic's forces' morale would increase more than eighteen percent for each "impossible" target I neutralize.
Such incredible victories would demoralize the putrid citizens of the Empire as much as they would encourage our heroic comrades!
It's a good plan, Forex. Make it happen.
I agree.
All right, Forex. We'll give it a shot.
Can't hurt, I guess.
It won't do the Republic much good if you get shot to pieces.
You could also be destroyed.
That's correct, sir. My calculations have shown that the inspirational value of martyrdom is less than sixteen percent, with a maximum duration of only fourteen months.
As always, we are left with no choice but absolute victory!
I'll inform you as soon as I locate a suitable target, sir!
It is an amazing thing to know that you are exceptional, sir. I'm sure you know the feeling, given your incredible service record.
My programming, my weaponry, my armor--all state-of-the-art. And my power core--a true marvel!
Other droids may look like me, or have some of my capabilities, but none of them have my power core. I'm very proud to be so unique.
The differences among us are what give the Republic its strength.
Individuality is important.
Exactly, sir! Billions of unique individuals, coming together to contribute to the greater good. It's truly inspiring.
Where did your power core come from, anyway?
Tell me about your power core.
I don't know anything about its origins. All I know is it gives me the ability to be exceptional!
Do you ever stop talking about yourself?
You're really egotistical.
I am always happy to discuss the Republic's achievements, and I do feel that I'm an excellent example.
I see Havoc Squad in much the same way. We are set apart from other infantry teams by one thing: you.
Thanks to your wise and courageous leadership, Havoc Squad is the finest military unit in the Republic. You are what makes Havoc special.
It's very kind of you to say that, Forex.
Thank you very much.
By analyzing our unit's strengths, we can better utilize them against our depraved enemies!
I'm just another soldier. Nothing more.
I just do my job.
The soldiers of the Republic are all very impressive, but surely none of them can compare with you!
Flattery is a waste of time, Forex.
Don't suck up.
Agreed, sir. That's why I always speak the simple truth!
Let's return to the fight, sir--it's already been too long since I saw Imperial soldiers stomped into the muck where they belong!
Sir! Allow me to reiterate my pleasure at serving in your command.
Since my verbobrain was first activated, I have longed to engage the enemies of freedom directly.
Under your noble leadership, I can finally fulfill the mission the Republic's peerless scientists designed me for!
It's good that you're so enthusiastic about our mission.
I'm glad you're happy.
I can't take all of the credit for my enthusiasm, of course. I owe everything to my primary designer--Doctor Boab Deduun.
Who programmed you, Forex?
Tell me about your designers.
My primary systems were designed by one of the greatest scientists in the Republic: Doctor Boab Deduun!
Are Republic war droids normally so eager for violence?
You love killing Imps, huh?
I apologize, sir. I have no love for violence--merely a passion for annihilating all threats to our glorious society.
I assure you, I was designed by one of the foremost minds in the Republic--Doctor Boab Deduun.
Thanks to Doctor Deduun, I can understand the importance of our fight, and the extent of the threats we face. And I can fight harder for it.
There's nothing better than fighting for a cause you believe in.
Good to hear.
I couldn't agree more, sir!
Could you introduce me to Doctor Deduun sometime?
Can I meet Deduun?
I would be happy to do so, but Dr. Deduun's lab is highly classified--even I don't know its actual location.
If an opportunity to meet him ever comes, you will be the first person I inform, sir!
You don't really "love" the Republic, you're just designed to.
It's still just programming.
Exactly, sir! And due to the sophistication of my design, my love for the Republic far exceeds what most biological beings are capable of.
But I've spoken enough about myself--let us return to our noble mission!
Sir! There are matters we should discuss privately, the next time we return to our ship.
If possible, sir, I'd like to speak with you at our next opportunity!
I don't need to discuss anything with you at the moment, sir.
For the Republic!
I will remain vigilant as ever.
As you wish, sir.
I will follow your lead, sir.
Death before defeat!
We must show no hesitation or reservation in our war against the Empire, friend--our enemy certainly won't!
Sir! Allow me to reiterate my pleasure at serving in your command.
Absolutely, sir! My success is a mathematical and moral certainty!
As always, we are left with no choice but absolute victory!
We'll have this war won in no time, sir!
I'm glad you share my enthusiasm!
Nothing is too dangerous for Havoc Squad, sir!
Fantastic, sir!
No Imperial will stand in our way! The Republic will triumph!
We will fight until the last Imperial lies dying at our feet!
